cleaned_text: Random technical wiki fact #2 You can adjust the length of the bars in the multiple vote above by tweaking your own personal [monobook.css](/wiki/Special:MyPage/monobook.css) file. Simply copy and paste the following code into it: .votecolumnback { width:100px !important; } The bars will now be 100px long. You can adjust this to suit your browser settings. RationalWiki to do list Contents: [New article [Article writing resources](#Article_writing_resources) - [Technical](/wiki/RationalWiki:To_do_list/Technical) If you are really bored, you can help [RationalWiki](/wiki/RationalWiki) by writing stuff for us. If you are really really bored, you can visit [articles for deletion](/wiki/RationalWiki:Articles_for_deletion) and see what needs pruning. You can also help [expand](/wiki/RationalWiki:DUMP) articles. This is a place where: - You can add topics that you think might be good article subjects. - You can draw people's attention to articles which you think are mission-critical and/or need work. - You can find articles that are nearing front page status and bask in the reflected glory of getting "your" article on the main page. - You can find bits of random wikicruft that fitted nowhere else. If you find yourself creating a stub-level article just to remove a link from the list, consider whether you should be doing it at all. Make a new page Resources Here are lists of resources that may aid in article writing. Quality control[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=RationalWiki:To_do_list/Resources&action=edit§ion=T-1)] Good sources for research[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=RationalWiki:To_do_list/Resources&action=edit§ion=T-2)] New article suggestions [ [edit](https://rationalwiki.org/w/index.php?title=RationalWiki:To_do_list/Suggestions&action=edit)] [ [view](/wiki/RationalWiki:To_do_list/Suggestions)] | | |How to add new entries: | - Expand each of the year subsections and Ctrl-F or Cmd-F to see if your suggestion already exists. - If no one has suggested it, yet, add your entry under Put article suggestions [here](https://rationalwiki.org/w/index.php?title=RationalWiki:To_do_list/Suggestions&action=edit§ion=T-1) (if you like focused editing) or at the top of the most recent year under [Recent](/wiki/RationalWiki:To_do_list#Recent) (if you don't mind doing tons of scrolling). - Considering [searching for](https://rationalwiki.org/w/index.php?search) and linking to related existing RationalWiki articles as well as the Wikipedia entry on your suggested topic in order to help stimulate interest. Put article suggestions here[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=RationalWiki:To_do_list/Suggestions&action=edit§ion=T-1)] | | |If you click the [|[Edit](https://rationalwiki.org/w/index.php?title=RationalWiki:To_do_list/Suggestions&action=edit§ion=T-1)] link next to "Put article suggestions here" and edit in this section here, the editor window won't show the full list of recent suggests and new articles, so you won't have to scroll as much to preview your changes. Its influence is as big as that of big Youtubers and also attract [a](/wiki/Reddit) [certain](/wiki/Incels) [crowd](/wiki/4chan). This is a double-edged sword. On one hand, there's the fact that many of them have bad sleep and eating habits, because they are required to stream alot for [several](https://i.imgur.com/nKo42ko.png) [hours](https://i.imgur.com/2oHlQlx.png) (some of them stream for [almost half a day](https://i.imgur.com/S9YFUQf.png)) for their agencies (big players here being [Hololive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hololive_Production), [Nijisanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nijisanji) & [VShojo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VShojo)) (if they aren't indies). There are low vibrations, low aerodynamic noise, and low heating at high speeds. In transonic flight the drag is drastically reduced compared to existing airfoils which ensures very high fuel-efficiency at transonic and supersonic speeds. Moreover, the center of pressure remains close to the center of symmetry, meaning no jump of pitching moment, and insignificant roll and yaw moments. Also, there are no lift fluctuations, so in conclusion this will mean a smooth transition from subsonic to supersonic flight!
